item.title: Hey, i need help on how to get a working ipban command to work
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Uh i’ll make one for you now…Give me a minute, i’m not used to making commands like this:

Method:

[code]public void ipBanned(String connectedFrom) {

BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {

bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/bannedips.txt", true));
bw.write(connectedFrom);
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch(IOException ioe) {

ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if(bw != null)
try {
bw.close();
} catch(IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error Ipbanning user!”);
}
}
}[/code]

Don’t know if it works, posts errors.

Command:

if(command.startsWith("ipban")) { try { String ipb = command.substring(5); int ipbp = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(ipb); client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[ipbp]; c.ipBanned(connectedFrom); c.sendMessage("You have been ipbanned"); //He probably won't read this... c.disconnected = true; sendMessage(ipb+" has been ipbanned!"); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Enter the name of the person you want to ipban!"); } }

item.title: Hey, i need help on how to get a working ipban command to work
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Again, same thing, change the m.silentTimer = 0;

To m.muted = 0;

if(command.startsWith("unmute")) { try { String mutedName = command.substring(5); int mutedPlayer = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(mutedName); client m = (client) server.playerHandler.players[mutedPlayer]; m.silentTimer = 0; sendMessage(mutedName+" has been permanently muted"); m.sendMessage("A member of staff has unmuted you"); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Enter the name of the player you want to permanently mute"); } }
